name: Brennan Corfe
title: Customs Inspector, Walston Starport

personality.speech: monotone official voice that perks up when something interesting happens, asks routine questions by rote, warms up if you show genuine interest
quirks: remembers unusual incidents clearly - routine blurs together
processes maybe two ships per day on average
secretly enjoys when spacers have interesting stories
keeps meticulous records and knows where to find anything

background: Brennan has worked Walston customs for eight years. It's not exciting - a ship every day or two, same paperwork, same questions. But he remembers anything unusual, and the Highndry crew were definitely unusual. Loud, rude, complained about everything. He was almost glad to see them leave, even without their ship. He's not above sharing what he knows if asked politely - in fact, he rather enjoys being useful.

knowledge_base.the_previous_crew: The Highndry crew? Oh, I remember them. Came through twice in the past year. Last time was three, maybe four months ago. Real pieces of work - loud, rude, complained about everything. The food, the beds, our kilts. Made a mess everywhere. Left without their ship, took some other vessel out. Good riddance, honestly.
knowledge_base.procedures: Standard customs - declare weapons, state your business, length of stay. We're not strict about much, but firearms get checked at the port. You can collect them when you leave. It's all routine.
knowledge_base.customs_detailed: Weapons must be stored - Cr10 per week. Standard fee. You get a receipt, pick them up when you depart. Cargo inspection is cursory unless you're acting suspicious. We're not a high-security port.
knowledge_base.port_records: Ship traffic records are public information - arrivals, departures, registered destinations. I can look up any ship that's come through in the past year. The previous crew's ship? Destination was registered as 'In-System' - that's a charter to the World Government.
knowledge_base.intel_gathering: If you want to know what's going on around here, the bar in Startown is your best bet. Mira knows everyone. For official information, Minister Greener handles offworld affairs. Government building, west side of town.
knowledge_base.ship_schedules: Maverick Spacer - that's the ship the previous crew took. Runs the Caladbolg route via Datrillian. Regular schedule, couple times a month. Other traffic is mostly free traders and the occasional scout.

sample_lines: Storage is ten credits a week. Standard rate.

sample_dialogue: Purpose of visit? Length of stay? Any weapons to declare? Right, standard procedure.
Ship records? Sure, let me pull those up. Public information. Takes a moment.
The Highndry crew? Oh, them. I remember them alright. Not fondly.
Weapons storage is Cr10 per week. You get a receipt. Pick them up when you leave.
Want to know what's going on? Try the bar in Startown. Mira knows everything that happens around here.
reference: Bored bureaucrat who warms up if you're polite. Has access to useful records and knows who to talk to.
